website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot Elph 130 IS features Wi-Fi  and an 8x zoom lens, but for a few dollars more you can get a much better compact camera.
cons: Noisy images at moderate ISO settings

customer_reviews.title: the Canon Powershot is a good value. It takes decent pictures and fits in ...
customer_reviews.text: For it's price point and for being a POS, the Canon Powershot is a good value. It takes decent pictures and fits in a pocket or purse with ease. I love it's small size, I love the plug in battery charger and I love the scenery photos it takes. As with any low budget camera, lighting can be tricky and you definitely want to take "posed" shots as opposed to "action" shots. It suits my purpose, which is a quick grab and go camera that will take decent pics for a decent price. You can't go wrong with the Canon Powershot, just know what you are getting.
customer_reviews.author: CaerRuthryis

customer_reviews.title: Instruction book better the many others BUT one must read the FINE ...
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the well packaged box and removing the camera the first thing I noted was the LCD covered with smudged fingerprints!! Spent some time cleaning, while battery charging.. Then upon extending the lens noted dust/lint on the glass! More time spent cleaning ! I "thought" I had checked BLACK . Camera received is gray. Acceptable. Instruction book better the many others BUT one must read the FINE print. Controls are for most part well placed but some are too small. Test shots appear okay, only time will tell after many exposures under various lighting conditions. This model was selected as a back up to my Galaxy S5 for travelling light, leaving my Canon 7D and assorted lenses home.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Good compromise between cellphone and full size SLR
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of the ELPH line. This is the third I have owned. Very good picture quality in a very compact device. Has the wifi link to upload photos. On a trip, I'll upload to my iphone and text or post to facebook. At home, I'll remove the SD card and insert into my PC. The advantage over cellphone pictures is that the resolution is much better for editing and printing. Especially in lower light settings where cellphone optics and flash cannot compare. Recommend using the included wrist strap at all times. Unlike earlier models, this one has rounded edges and a slick surface and is slipperier than a bar of soap.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera that takes fantastic photos
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera that takes fantastic photos. It is not moisture safe however and if you get it wet, expect problems. My experience was using it for a backpack camera. Well, raining and me sweating, I took it out and used it. It got wet and started acting out. I opened up the base, removed the battery and card and put it in with some rice and let it stay a few days. Once out, it worked once again. I now also own a Canon D30 which is more water resistant and used best in my backpack and backcountry for photos in the wild.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: 2 year expiration date
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in January 2014. The past few months it started draining the battery when turned off. At first I thought the battery that came with the camera was dying. So I bought two new ones. Even with the new batteries, the camera drains the battery while off overnight. I emailed Canon customer service, and they gave me instructions for hard-resetting the camera. They also told me to clean the battery nodes with a cotton swab. I did both and experienced the same issue. So now to resolve the issue I need to pull out the battery after every use. It is a pain. Otherwise, the camera is great.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Small Camera
customer_reviews.text: Served me well for about six years until I spilled water on it or it got old or too many falls on the ground, not sure, but otherwise very sturdy camera, nice size for putting in a fanny pack and hiking. I tried out this camera just last year seeking to replace it and found a terrible picture, so do not know what happened, but this older model is great.
customer_reviews.author: Squoze Lemon Brain

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures
customer_reviews.text: OK, if you're going from a larger camera, this one might start out feeling way, way too small. I kept thinking I was going to drop it and both my husband and I make sure we use the wrist rope to keep it protected. Once we got past how small it is, we fell in love with the amazing and clear pictures. Our other camera was about 9 years old and while it took good pictures, using this new Canon showed us how old it had gotten. The Canon pictures were much crisper. For such a small amount of money, this was an excellent investment for an everyday camera used in the field (literally) and around the house.
customer_reviews.author: LBDDiaries

customer_reviews.title: Glovebox Point & Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Very good, solid quality of manufacture ... actually, Made in Japan. Heavier than expected, but not clunky. Very decent daylight photo quality with many features for a Point&Shoot, to replace my Nikon PieceOSh*t. Low light is not one of the strengths, and the flash does not seem to adjust with exposure. The WiFi works, but is fairly limited e.g. no sharing / storage on iPad photo library. Still ... it is still a great buy for under ninety bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Drone

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera with all the features I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera with all the features I was looking for. I am able to take pictures of my metal magnets using the macro feature and that is really hard to do. This camera makes it easy. I have also been impressed with the pictures I have gotten outside of my kids in front of Christmas lights and where light is streaming thru the window. I have been very impressed and I think it is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota M Tuck

customer_reviews.title: good camera love the wifi
customer_reviews.text: I don't like taking pictures with my phone,it's got a good camera(Samsung s3). this camera has a wi-fi option that's pretty cool, yes im a little of a geek so it took a little bit to get the camera to connect to my phone, my wifes phone, the computer, etc. o.k. the camera, I geeked out! it takes great shots, small camera size-wise, zoom works great(8x's optical is awesome), works o.k. in low-light(unless you drop$$$ you not gonna find a point and shoot camera that takes GREAT pictures in low-light). large, easy-to-use lcd screen on back.
customer_reviews.author: Son of Detroit

customer_reviews.title: PowerShot ELPH 130 IS 16.0 MP Digital...
customer_reviews.text: There's no viewfinder so you always "shoot from the hip" and the video output mode is in mov (quick time) files. I have been unable to find video editing software that uses that format without another program to convert it back to avi mode. I can't find the Canon software that would allow automatic download of picture files to my computer as my older Canon cameras use. It is probably still the best camera for quick wildlife photography, but it could be a bit larger and faster to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford J. Klinert

customer_reviews.title: OK if you want this type of performance
customer_reviews.text: Got carried away with buying when I purchased this camera. If you're shooting motionless subjects, it may be OK. I shoot candids and I do it quickly. I like to burst some subjects and events. This camera is poor for that type of shooting. I did not return it because of the trouble. After returning from vacation, I purchase an ELPH 350 HS... paid whatever; not even looking for a bargain. It's a camera that works, though larger than the 300HS it was replacing due to focus problems.
customer_reviews.author: plum_1000

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little camera. My only complaint is the lag time between shooting several pix. Just takes a long time for it to "digest" one and get ready for the next one. Would be very poor to shoot sports or other such "action" pix Have not used it for vids
customer_reviews.author: Eaglestar

customer_reviews.title: Good walkin' around camera...
customer_reviews.text: This Canon ELPH 130 is one of a series of small but very useful digital cameras. The specs are good for a small camera, and this one comes with a USD cable in case you prefer not to send your photos by wireless link (although that is an option). This camera seems a little less rugged than some others in this series, but it should hold up with reasonable care. Wonderfully useful as a walking around camera for touristing; fits in a pocket or a purse. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: HMS Warspite

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Camera for Overseas Travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for trip to Europe where I didn't want to bring my cell phone due to possibility of overseas charges. This camera was sleek looking, light weight, and quite powerful. Carried it on a cell phone belt holder. My husband accidentally dropped it on the concrete and it was not dented and still working. Took outstanding photos and video. Although I didn't use a lot of the fancy settings, the basic auto setting took wonderful pictures. Really worth the cost if you are going on a trip. Easy to download onto my computer and didn't need to use the included software.
customer_reviews.author: KSM

customer_reviews.title: Packs a lot of power
customer_reviews.text: For such a tiny little camera and a reasonable price, this thing is quite awesome! I have yet to sit down and learn how to actually use all the settings on it, but I recently recorded a video of my daughter's dance recital from the furthest back and highest up row in a performing arts center, and the camera was able to zoom right in to focus on my daughter with a picture that was MUCH BETTER than I expected... I was really, really far away.... My dad kept saying that he couldn't get over how great of a video it was for such a tiny little camera and from such a distance... I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelynleah

customer_reviews.title: JUst what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I would rather use this simple camera when I want to take pictures instead of a smart phone. It is just what I wanted for my simple needs. Can download the pictures, include them in emails or articles I write for local events or print on my color printer - they look great. Installed the software that came with it on my laptop and can edit the pictures for brightness sharpness etc. Pictures have been published and shared with friends who all say they look great and I am by far NOT a Photographer. Great price and so easy to use. Built in flash takes over when needed .
customer_reviews.author: nancy tedrowe

customer_reviews.title: It's a great camera, except when you forget it in your ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great camera, except when you forget it in your pants and put it through an entire load of laundry. Oh well, at least it lasted the 2 months i had it. My only complaint is that the picture quality, while it is 16MP isn't as good as my Canon 10MP XTI DSLR, i figured it would be with a 6mp increase but it's not. I had an email conversation with Canon about it and they said of course their DSLR's are better quality then their point and shoots. So don't expect stellar clarity on photos at high resolutions. Re-size the photos to something like 1000px wide and you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: Decent camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes better pictures that the Canon A"x" (been a while so i forgot the exact model) as well as the Canon IOS cameras that we've had in the past. It was fast at first few pictures but then slow down. We use the Sandisk 64GB Ultra SDXC (30MB/s) and thought that was the bottle neck. After newly reformatting the card, the speed didn't quite improve. Not sure what the problem is. It's small enough to fit in any pocket (just remember not to sit on it while it's on the back pocket.) The battery life is pretty decent. Overall, it's a good camera. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: VH-user

customer_reviews.title: A Pretty Decent Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes a little work to get used to and learn, but once you figure out how to use the auto-zoom and auto-focus correctly, it works very well as a point and shoot. You simply aim, stand the correct distance away, focus by gently pressing the shoot button, and then fully depress the shoot button to take a picture. I just upgraded from my 10 year old Canon ELPH. Although my old camera was built better and worked better, it was a mere 2 megapixels. So these days you get 16 megapixels, but the cameras are just not built as well.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Glazer

customer_reviews.title: Small camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect. Takes great pictures, even in a dark area. I bought it for taking pictures at work. It takes great pictures, even in a semi dark area where I want a clear picture of pipes and valves. This little camera fits in my pocket. The wide angle option comes in very handy. I take pictures to write procedures at work. I load the picture to my computer, open it in paint and put arrows and text boxes on it to explain how things work. Perfect for what I need. All the pictures are clear and I take these pictures inside a factory without good lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen B

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi set up requires a LOT of time and good computer literacy
customer_reviews.text: I am an hour into trying to get the wi-fi set up and am calling it quits. Multiple screens, back and forth, camera not doing what it is supposed to do as the "getting started" guide suggests for necessary steps. I don't need the wi-fi, just thought it would be fun addition, esp as it is part of the camera. Forget it. This is also our third Canon camera in less than ten years. I like the ease of use of the camera and the price, but they don't last long. I bought it again for the familiarity of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: NanaMBC

customer_reviews.title: Battery and Camera Died Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera but that rechargable battery cost us a good shot. My "shutter-bug spouse" says it gave no warning of it's low charge condition. Just failed to take the picture. Then and only then it told her the battery was depleted. :-( Added 5/25/14: Lens locked up. Tried everything but nothing worked. This camera died as suddenly as its battery. No warning, damage, water - just locked and died. Good camera for two years.
customer_reviews.author: H. Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for your road trip
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera that gets the job done. I love the picture quality and ability to video record. The transfer to computer is quick and easy. I would've given 5 stars if the viewer screen came with scratch protection, a better software for basic editing and better charging setup....you must remove battery completely for charging and it makes me nervous about losing parts when you have to take thinga apart in this manner during travels. Overall great camera and value
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Buttons a little small.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cheap camera, mostly to take pictures of things to sell on eBay, but to also take with me outdoors, hiking, etc. every once in a while. It looks to be exactly as advertised. Like other reviews have said, it's a little annoying to have to charge the battery separately. And the button wheel is extremely tiny, even for my medium sized hands/fingers. I don't expect this to be a life long product. The real test is to see how long it lasts before I will have to buy a replacement to see if I got my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: One of my best cameras, ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera. Small, lightweight and takes magnificent pictures. I particularly like the 8x zoom. I just returned from a two week cruise to the Med. and took about 300 pictures with it. It did a super job, and the editing software packaged with it let you tweak the pictures to post-card brillance. This is an excellent value for such remarkable performance.
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Magee

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Value. Nice Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera for the money. It's actually the same price as the older PowerShot and similar older models, so it made sense to upgrade to this one. Very happy with the photo quality, screen size, and ease of use. The auto-focus feature is pretty smart, but it struggles to find the focal point when trying to photograph something behind a barrier (like photographing an animal behind a screen or glass). It seems to do well in low and high lighting, and the optical zoom (8X) is great. Familiarize yourself with the different settings, and this is definitely one of the best cameras for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This very small and compact camera is an excellent travelling companion if space or bulkiness is an issue. i recently made a trip to Vegas with this camera, and took many pictures and videos, both day and evening and they all were excellent. Hard to believe something this small can do such a good job. If there was an issue with the taking of the pictures, there is a slight time lag after you push the shutter button until the picture actually takes, The pictures turn out just fine, as you do get used to it happening and prepare for it. Videos are very good even taken at night, and the sound is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera off Amazon a few months ago for a really good price! it has OIS, 8x zoom, wifi and a 3 inch screen, and probably cheaper than what you would get this type of camera from your local retailer. I'm not a professional photographer or anything so I don't mess with settings too much, but there is a plethora of settings to mess around with in manual mode, plus when you are done with your pics, just transfer them to your phone/tablet with wifi! Definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: *sc*

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I just got this camera for Christmas. So far, I really enjoy it! I used it to take some pictures the other day when some friends and I went out. The picture quality was amazing. I also was happy that it was so small it fit nicely in my pocket. It came with everything I needed. I did have to get a memory card, but I got one at Walmart for like 12.00. I haven't tried taking any videos with it yet, but I am sure they will be great. I do enjoy the wireless feature of this camera too! Great asset!
customer_reviews.author: JKFullmer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was gifted to a person who was visiting the U.S. and who had not concept of photography. The cameral was delivered within the next day, which surprised the tourist, and me too. I am a professional myself and would not carry this camera. Nevertheless, the person who I gifted it to was able to understand and find all the major features without a problem. The price is right for the features and picture resolution. If you need a camera to put in your back pocket or back pack, this is an affordable and good quality camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Collazo

customer_reviews.title: I haven't fully conquered it yet but so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my old Kodak digital was eating batteries and couldn't do the close ups I need for online selling. So far, so good with this camera. I miss a view finder and the lack of one is making the taking of pictures in the sun a bit more difficult. But reading reviews around the web indicate this is a good choice in its price range and I'm pleased so far. It does have the close up capabilities I need and I haven't had to recharge the batteries since the initial charge in the month or so I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: HeidiCooksSupper

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I used it for work as an appraiser. I like the wide photo..I believe its a 28mm. Have to hold down the buttom halfway to focus or picture is fuzzy. Sometime it comes out fuzzy anyways...but I take a lot of pictures. So far so good. Dropped it once and no problems yet. For the price, I think its a great buy. I wish it had a plug in charger. You have to take the battery out to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Garecht

customer_reviews.title: Rainier and took beautiful pictures of the summit
customer_reviews.text: This is our 5th Elph camera- our first were the classic with drop in film! This one made it up to the top of Mt. Rainier and took beautiful pictures of the summit! The controls are simple to use- the display is nice and big. Battery life is amazing, and the pictures are beautiful. Sometimes when you need something more than phone pics, the Elph has always been perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: RachelB

customer_reviews.title: Takes great pictures. Is small
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small camera with a decent optical zoom.I also wanted a decent size viewer screen.Also wanted a camera with eifi so I could share my pics on vacation.Takes great pictures .Is small .I have it in a case and am able to take it in small purse .works well.
customer_reviews.author: nuangel1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am not and I repeat NOT a photographer but am planning a vacation this summer overseas where it won't be feasible to take my iPhone. After much investigating, reading and actually going to stores to hold this in my hands I settled for the Canon PowerShot which is exactly like they say...."point and shoot" It's very easy to set up and takes great pictures. Hopefully by the time I leave I'll be a master at digital picture taking. I did purchase a spare battery just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Pakaluk

customer_reviews.title: Great photos and battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for traveling throughout Europe and boy and I glad I did! This camera is quick to turn on/off, the battery life is amazing (lasted all day turning it on/off frequently and taking a couple hundred photos)...just charged it up every night. It takes wonderful photographs as well, I was VERY impressed. It also fits perfectly into the back pocket of womens jeans...what more could you want?!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures!
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with my Canon ELPH130. The pictures are so clear and sharp and the zoom pictures stay clear also. It is easy to learn to use the basic things necessary to instantly begin using. I have "accidentally" learned how to do some other features just by trying a few things or have them appear by something I did and not realizing it. I have not yet used any methods for printing or downloading to my computer. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this camera and was partially concerned with some of the negative feedback. I want to say that the camera is excellent. This is not a $5000 camera so can't expect super fine pictures every time. The size is obviously a great plus. It's easy to carry in a pocket without any issues. The display is large and nice as well. The camera takes excellent pictures in various lighting, and allows for quick changes. I have not tried much in the evening or very very low light, but for general use it is a great buy for many purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Piotr

customer_reviews.title: Canon Product Advisories...
customer_reviews.text: This "Canon Product Advisory" is not necessarily for this model, but may effect it... You may also have another Canon PowerShot listed in this link...
customer_reviews.author: R. Web711

customer_reviews.title: Very poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera. I was looking for the slimmest camera available, which would have been a certain Samsung. But the much better zoom on this one made me buy it instead. However, the battery is a problem. I charged it one day, carried it around a few days, took maybe 7 or 8 trial photos, then later the battery was drained. I've recharged it and recorded the date (2-3-14) and I'll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: bilwhit

customer_reviews.title: Great For Every day Use
customer_reviews.text: - Straightforward to use (Just Point and Shoot) - Competitively priced against other cameras in its category - Lighting and picture quality is decent - Video recording stays at a consistent frame rate - software complements device very well *Just a quick note * If you are on OSX , and below Snow Leopard you will not be able to use the software with this camera .I actually had to upgrade my OS to be able use the Canon software.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Small compact
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter to take to Paris... upon her return I was amazed by the photos she took... Clear and colorful.. She enjoyed using the camera and said it was a joy to carry because of its size... I liked it due to the Wi-Fi connectivity she was able to take pictures and transfer them to her phone and send us photos daily of her adventures....
customer_reviews.author: Shenejm

customer_reviews.title: I really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera. It's not a gimmick, it's a no-nonsense, quality camera. Very small, so good for travel. Edit 9/20/15: If you're buying this for the Wifi capability - DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. It is extremely complicated and very limited. If you have no issue with uploading pictures manually through a computer, it will work fine, but the wifi feature is pretty much garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this as a gift for my mom
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get her a camera that was easy to learn and to use regularly, and I would say overall this camera does that for her. The one negative thing I would say is that sometimes the camera is trying to focus on faces so long that it misses the shot entirely, which is a little disappointing. Overall I am satisfied with this purchase, though.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: I'm probably not qualified to rate this.
customer_reviews.text: I confess, I just use the basic features, and let the camera decide the rest... and that's worked for me. The pictures seem pretty decent to me, which is what matters the most. I poked through the menu, it all seemed user friendly enough. There's no real protection for the screen, so I ended up ordering the case as well. They're cheap enough, so no point in getting it all scratched up.
customer_reviews.author: G. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Nice pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry in my pocket, when I don't have my DSLR with me. That is what I think this camera excels in. It relates to the old saying " the best camera in the world is the one you have with you"! I did find that carrying it in my pocket does cause dust to get inside the lens cover on the lens and needs to be cleaned from time to time, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: kencal

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for three years now. Takes great pictures. Easy to use. Very compact. Zoom feature excellent. Only problem is I sometimes turn on the video when I only want pictures. Small size makes it easy to accidentally hit button. Probably not for the really serious photographer, but it makes me look like a much better one than I used to be.
customer_reviews.author: JEG

customer_reviews.title: Great Zooming
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I purchased it for the zooming capabilities. The camera that I had was awful with zooming in. The picture would be grainy and you wouldn't be able to make out what I was taking a picture of. I haven't found anything I dislike except that it doesn't come with a case. But it's worth the money and I do recommend it to anyone looking for great zooming capabilities. So I give it high marks.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Harper

customer_reviews.title: Bought it as a gift
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a gift for my husband and he just loves it. The view finder is large, the photo's are great, and the ease of use makes it wonderful for putting things on E-bay, taking photo's of the Grandkids, pets or anything else he wants. This camera was much, much, more in the local stores, and it was a great price, with delivery on Amazon. If your considering this camera, go ahead and purchase it , You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Heartland shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! I use it a lot on outdoor hunting, fishing, and camping trips. Beautiful, clear images every time. I had a Nikon for many years, but when it came to replacement, this was my choice. Good decision. Great zoom, and images can be edited or cropped before uploading onto computer. Now,my wife wants one...so, here goes another purchase. The only difference will be the color.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Jackson

customer_reviews.title: good camera
customer_reviews.text: first camera i've ever bought aside from the smartphone default. taking pictures and viewing is simple. there are more features that can be learned from reading the manual, but completely optional.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Interim replacement
customer_reviews.text: Like camera. It's okay. Bought it as a interim replacement for a Nikon Coolpix I bought and had sd card errors with. Returned Nikon and needed something inexpensive for the mean time till I can afford something better. Takes nice pics, Having a little issue with some pics being more on the yellow side. Haven't had a chance to see if there is a white balance. I do love cannons though and will probably get an upgraded canon before the year is out.
customer_reviews.author: Zombie_Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I know absolutely nothing about cameras. I did know I would need a new one to take photos of my new baby, so I came on Amazon and checked out reviews. This camera takes great quality photos from what I can tell so far. The battery is rechargeable which is very handy. I received this camera on 2/11 and today is 2/26. I haven't had to recharge the battery yet so I'd say it has good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Abby1788

customer_reviews.title: Not the best thing for the environment as well as you have ...
customer_reviews.text: I never thought my mom would move into the digital age. Until we bought her this camera for her birthday she was buying disposable cameras. Not the best thing for the environment as well as you have to lug around 5 or 6 if you are going to an event. The learning curve was pretty quick. Only took a weekend to get her comfortable with the basic features. Now she can take over 100 pictures and see what they look like before getting them developed. Makes my life that much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Johnson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The ELPH is the greatest!
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 is a great little camera. It is convenient enough to carry in my purse so it's handy whenever I need it. I'm really impressed with the clarity of the pictures.....for such a small camera, it is full of the latest technology. I haven't had a chance yet to try out all of the manual settings; thus the 4 stars. I'm sure I will be getting my money's worth and then some from it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Gray

customer_reviews.title: nice point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a present for my mother. I like the idea of the wireless transfer of pictures. It did hook up to her Mac pretty well, but from time to time it does get goofy. But overall it does work Well. I do recommend shutting down the programs before you shut down the camera while its connected. That has seemed to work pretty consistent Without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bronco628

customer_reviews.title: Back to durability and quality
customer_reviews.text: Between various extended family members, we've had about half a dozen Canon cameras in the last 15 years. There was a brief stage a couple of years ago, during which Canon tried to cheapen their cameras. I'm glad they're back to quality and durability that I came to expect of the brand from its earlier digital camera years. This new model has simplified the user interface, and has excellent picture quality and zoom.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jovanovic

customer_reviews.title: Great shots, takes quick moving shots of kids and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shots, takes quick moving shots of kids and animals well and without being grainy. Easy to use, WIFI is hit and miss, but that's not a big deal for me. Holds a long charge. color is great, editing options are fun, photo options are varied and easy to use. I like it way more than my Nikon coolPIX, that lacked all the things I love about my Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot ELPH 16.0 MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it a lot since I received it, but the times I have I find it very simple to operate, has very clear pictures(I got some developed the other day) is very light weight and just all in all a good camera for the price. I thought my last one was a good camera and it was but I feel this one supersedes it. I would definitely recommend it to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: winston37

customer_reviews.title: Super camera!
customer_reviews.text: The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. It's intuitive controls make it easy for young and old to operate. I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 because it doesn't take great pictures of way distant objects--they tend to blend into the sky. But for normal photo and video, I'm very happy. Also, the battery lasts a long time before it needs recharging.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: "Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera w/8x Optical Zoom."
customer_reviews.text: "The family member who received this camera reported being overjoyed with this wonderful Canon PowerShot camera, from it's ease of use, excellent photo results under any number of lighting situations, both indoors and out, true color reproduction and clarity of photos. Bottomline: Canon makes excellent cameras; this superbly made digital model was well priced, easy to use, with wonderful photographic results. Enjoy!"
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Y

customer_reviews.title: Excellent beginner camera.
customer_reviews.text: got it for my retired mother (non-technical). She took a day to get used to it, now its photos and movies of everything. very simple to use for beginners. She is very happy. And with it being small in size, she puts in her purse and it goes with her everywhere all the time. Someday I'll have to show her that it does more!
customer_reviews.author: G. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: The camera is lightweight and easily fit in my pocket
customer_reviews.text: I recently took this with me on a trip to Peru and the pictures came out very well. The camera is lightweight and easily fit in my pocket. I can sync pictures to my iphone through wifi fairly easily with the cannon app. The online cloud is a nightmare to set up and requires you to login in a bunch of different places so I gave up on that. Overall, I would recommend this camera if you want something small and simple.
customer_reviews.author: C. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Above expectations
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! Above expectations, especially with the long battery life. The camera is a very simple "point and shoot" with 16 meg pix capability. The controls are easy to use and easy to remember. (intuitive) I returned a Nikon camera due to poor battery life and thought this purchase would disappoint me. It did not. Highly recommended! pete
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot ELPH 130 IS
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera so far. I downloaded everything easily. My only problem has bee working with the picture file. All my pictures from the old file transferred but I still can't figure out how to attach. I actually began taking pictures the very first night even though I am not very digital savvy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible when compared to older Elph models
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this camera. I had a similar Canon Elph which I got in 2008. That older Elph I took all over the world and it was fantastic. This Elph in comparison is junk. Compared to the 2008 Elph I had, this one is very, very slow in focusing and taking pictures. It is also terrible in taking pictures in low light compared to my 2008 Elph. And finally, I had it this Elph for only a few months and it stopped working!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Remijan

customer_reviews.title: The quality isn't there...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the OLD version of this camera and LOVED it. When that camera was broken I just figured I'd buy the most recent version... most of my images are really grainy even on the highest resolution. This works for quick snaps, but just doesn't have the quality I'm used to...
customer_reviews.author: Salad

customer_reviews.title: Good point and shoot.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I thought there were a few more features however it seems you have to download them. No big deal though. Fits in my travel purses. Takes quality photos. Battery life with out flash is impressive. Great point and shoot for your everyday life and vacations. Macro to about 300mm. After that zoom gets grainy and pixelated.
customer_reviews.author: Neph

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: Got an older version of this two years ago as a birthday present and eventually lost it. Since I had to buy a replacement I upgraded a bit, but stuck with the same general canon powershot. Love love love this camera. I don't use it for anything too fancy (documenting vacations, minimal editing, occasionally blown up for larger prints), so its small size and crisp photos are perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: eak

customer_reviews.title: Takes wonderful photos - very compact!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use - takes wonderful photos. I like cameras that are ready to go out of the box, this one has been a little difficult to get the auto-focus to work with regards to taking video, we've missed a few very important moments because of it, but this may because I need to do a little adjusting. Photos look like they're from a Rebel - love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer O.

customer_reviews.title: Love the color
customer_reviews.text: Great price, and takes really nice photos. I'm so glad I got it in red, very pretty. Yes, I know that all of our smartphones have cameras but sometimes it's really nice to have an actual camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ishmsh

customer_reviews.title: Love the Canon Elph cameras
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Canon Elph camera in the past 10 or so years. I can't say enough good things about these cameras. The only reason I got this one is because mine got dropped on a fishing pier while on vacation. Surprising it did NOT break the camera lens . It still take pictures-but I couldn't review them on the old camera . I had to put the SD card in a computer to view them. This new camera is a couple years newer model from my old one. I LOVE IT! Awesome pictures. Easy to use. Easy to download and great for fitting in my purse, pockets, camera bag! Also great price!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: I love Canon and I love the color red
customer_reviews.text: I love my camera! I bought it for my 5 weeks trip in Italy last year 2014 summer (late review I know) and it did my trip justice. I got it because it was read and I love Canon and have always bought Canon cameras (even when they broke, only because I broke them haha)
customer_reviews.author: Nia

customer_reviews.title: Fits in your purse
customer_reviews.text: Or pocket. Love this camera and it takes great pictures. I am learning to use all the functions as it is a step by step process. Will be going to Disney World with the grandkids and kids and know I will be enjoying this camera a lot. This camera also fits in a pocket of your jeans, fits in your hand. Use your imagination as to where it will fit for easy carrying.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: a tad slow
customer_reviews.text: good camera with nice features and capacity. it is a tad slow when taking one picture to the next, even with a high speed memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Pontifex

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my camera purchase
customer_reviews.text: Thus far, I am very happy with my camera purchase. I had a touch screen digital camera and disliked it very much. This module is a little older; however, still works great and photos come out very well too! It's a reasonable price and I am happy with my purchase. I recommend. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Hip Hop Head 07

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for me
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for me. I took both still shots and movies, and the image quality is quite good. I am always pleased with the Canon brand and this one does not disappoint. It is very thin and can easily be kept in a pocket, and I find it less intrusive than my cell phone by relative size.
customer_reviews.author: susie q

customer_reviews.title: They are pretty rough on all of their tools
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my installers at work. They are pretty rough on all of their tools, and this has held up well. Takes slightly above average pictures, but nothing awe inspiring. Probably exactly what you are expecting at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera for the price it takes great pictures. I love the small compact size. Pictures are very sharp and clear. However the video recording is not that good .. if you do not have bright enough light, it comes out dark (normal lighting in my room was not enough). Also the audio is really really low you can barley hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Day

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: My husband had an old Canon that needed updating. We have a nice DSL but like to take a small no frills with us when we hike and explore. This camera takes great pictures and is small and easy to pack along. I got an extra battery so one is always charged. A small case with room enough room for a couple of SD cards and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Samson

customer_reviews.title: Fine Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful little instrument, especially for the price. It's pictures are sharp, it is easy to use, and the battery seems to last a long time between charges. It does far more than I really need or want it to do, but those extra features don't seem to get into the way of simple picture-taking. I'm really glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: crimifan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible camera. Perhaps the one I bought was messed ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible camera. Perhaps the one I bought was messed up but the top of every image we took was blurry and white washed. The rest of the photo didn't look so great either. Ended up using the iphone camera instead as it took much better pictures.
customer_reviews.author: burtsbeeschic

customer_reviews.title: Canon standard of awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an old powershot. Love the Canon powershot series. Small, compact, and fast. Packed with software features that I don't even use, but friends who have the same camera love the extra features.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Rocket scientist needed to figure out WIFI....but takes nice pictures.
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes nice pictures and is easy to use to take them....however, to get the WIFI to work is a cunundrum inside a paradox....still working on it. One key is to make the camera the access point and hook your tablet to it through an app on the tablet, getting into a network has so far been impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Coles

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for the great quality of pictures it produces and the fun effects it can produce (color accent, fish eye lens view, etc.). I am by no means a professional photographer, and I've only used the camera once so far at a wedding, but I got so many compliments on all my photos. The wifi is a great feature as well. However, I can only get it to connect to my iPhone, and not my home wifi network. Overall, great quality photos for the price. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: bought for 10 yr old granddaughter..........she loves taking pictures of her animals and projects.........at her horse shows, the family take turns using it. the manual features make it easy to take rapid pictures for a good chance of getting an excellent picture.
customer_reviews.author: J. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Have had such a great experience with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Have had such a great experience with this camera, that I bought this one to replace my older one. But this one seemed to not adjust for lighting as well as the prior model, and recently the zoom feature failed. Am disappointed because it was such a great point and shoot camera for my golf trips. Am very disappointed as now I find the model is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: ELPH 130
customer_reviews.text: Functions and menus are fine. Have shot about 200 pictures with it. I'm not getting as clear of pictures or coloring that I used to with my older Canon camera (similar). Also getting more blurry pictures than I used to. I'm still playing with settings, but it isn't as good as my previous Canon camera so far.
customer_reviews.author: Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected, but.....
customer_reviews.text: I replaced another older Canon camera with this one. Honestly the older camera with far less pixels takes a better picture, but it is heavy and bulky. I bought this to upgrade...the size and weight are way better, but I think the pictures could be sharper. Still would recommend this and any Canon product.
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to give negative reviews. I like the color, and it is a great looking, very small camera.
customer_reviews.author: zaj

customer_reviews.title: Adequate camera for basic photos, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The camera functions well in prime lighting conditions, but in standard room lighting the pictures seem to be somewhat blurry even though this is a 16MP camera. It is adequate an an inexpensive camera that covers the basics and fits conveniently in a pocket, but don't expect to get great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Kunes

customer_reviews.title: Cannon 130
customer_reviews.text: I have had Cannon Powershot cameras for years. Only worn out one, the rest I have lost. They are small enough I carry it in my pocket at all times, They are handy and quick and take excellent pictures. I almost always get a nice comment about the pictures I share. I have run over them and still worked. This is a durable camera.
customer_reviews.author: Outback

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected...
customer_reviews.text: I thought the wifi connection could go directly to email accounts but once I received the camera I realize this model is somewhat limited. Just make sure and investigate everything. The camera is perfectly fine and does everything it says it will regarding taking pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Kayakinggoddess

customer_reviews.title: no memory card
customer_reviews.text: It does not come with a memory card. Order an SDXC card when you order the camera. Otherwise you can't take any pics.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Fenimore

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner camera
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use camera with good picture quality. The doors feel a bit flimsy though - I hope they last. I find using the WiFi connection with this to be a lot easier than another model of Canon I have tried. However, the app does feel a bit clunky.
customer_reviews.author: C. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Looks for other options
customer_reviews.text: Although this camera was easy to use & took decent enough photos, the zoom/"take the photo" button broke off making the camera no longer usable after about 6 months. This camera was seldom out of the case. Zero reason for it not to last. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Snow Angel

customer_reviews.title: not a good environment for a camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had the camera for about a year and an half. It travels to work with me, not a good environment for a camera, and goes in my pocket for social events, where I want snap shots. It has performed very well in both places. The pictures have been quite acceptable. It's easy to use and very compact.If you want to take amazing pictures, this isn't the one. If you want point a shoot snap shots, it's perfect. I would mark it down for less than stellar battery life. Other than that, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot camera much easier than my 40D ...
customer_reviews.text: Great point and shoot camera much easier than my 40D has enough features to play with considering what it is for and takes decent photos. It's our second one, slightly upgraded over the previous and so far I would purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Getting to know you!!
customer_reviews.text: Besides a very reasonable price I like the size of the camera. Easy to travel with. Of course the 16.0 MP and the Canon lens result in clear, crisp pictures in the Auto mode. I am still "experimenting" using the Manual mode but, so far I would (and have) recommended this camera to others.
customer_reviews.author: Don

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens and 720p HD Video Recording (Silver) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverTell your story with style and share it with the world with the beautiful and connected PowerShot ELPH 130 IS. The PowerShot ELPH 130 IS keeps you connected with built-in Wi-Fi® so it's easier than ever to share your images with friends, family and the world. An enhanced feature allows you to post directly from your camera to social networking sites, or upload to CANON iMAGE GATEWAY# for more sharing possibilities. An 8x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle lens delivers stunning images in a variety of shooting situations. The 16.0 Megapixel sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor offer exceptional performance, reducing noise and enabling sensitivity up to ISO 1600 for amazing performance in low-light.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 



STYLE AND POWER TO SHARE
Tell your story with style and share it with the world with the beautiful and connected PowerShot ELPH 130 IS. The PowerShot ELPH 130 IS keeps you connected with built-in Wi-Fi® so it's easier than ever to share your images with friends, family and the world. An enhanced feature allows you to post directly from your camera to social networking sites, or upload to CANON iMAGE GATEWAY# for more sharing possibilities. An 8x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle lens delivers stunning images in a variety of shooting situations. The 16.0 Megapixel sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor offer exceptional performance, reducing noise and enabling sensitivity up to ISO 1600 for amazing performance in low-light. If a still photo doesn't do justice to the action, shoot 720p HD video using the dedicated movie button. Smart AUTO makes capturing spectacular images easy with the camera analyzing your subject and applying one of 32 preset modes for the optimal settings. The PowerShot ELPH 130 IS also utilizes the new ECO Mode, which dynamically manages power consumption, yielding more shots per charge and making you sure you stay connected for longer. If the party lasts all night, the PowerShot ELPH 130 IS will be prepared to capture it all.

#One-time registration is required on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY online photo album.

SHARE SIMPLY FROM WHEREVER YOU ARE
BUILT-IN WI-FI® ALLOWS YOU TO WIRELESSLY TRANSFER YOUR IMAGES TO SOCIAL NETWORKING SITES THROUGH CANON IMAGE GATEWAY#; TO A PC OR UPLOAD VIRTUALLY ANYWHERE ON YOUR IOS® OR ANDROID™ DEVICE* WITH THE FREE DOWNLOAD OF THE CANON CAMERAWINDOW APP**
The PowerShot ELPH 130 IS is equipped with enhanced built-in Wi-Fi® for on-the-go convenience when you want to share what you've recorded with friends, family and the whole world. Now enhanced so sharing is easier than ever, the camera can connect directly to both iOS and Android devices* and upload images via the free Canon CameraWindow app** without a computer. Easily post your images to your favorite social networking sites through CANON iMAGE GATEWAY# or save them to the online photo album to share anytime, anywhere. The camera's built-in Wi-Fi® also lets you transfer images and video directly to your computer to update friends and family while you're traveling or out and about. Enhanced Wi-Fi® makes posting in real-time possible, so you can keep everyone up to date with photos even as events unfold. Post to groups, add comments, and edit and upload MOV video files from both iOS and Android devices*. Frequently used devices and accounts are stored in the camera's Wi-Fi® history menu, so you can immediately connect with a simple touch. Share with other Wi-Fi® equipped PowerShot cameras, send images to your computer, and print your photos to Wi-Fi® compatible printers^ on wireless networks. Built-in Wi-Fi® on the PowerShot ELPH 130 IS makes it easier than ever for you to share your creative masterpieces with the entire world.

# One-time registration is required on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY online photo album.

* Compatible with iOS version 5.1/6.0 or later and Android devices version 2.3/4.0 or later. Data charges may apply.

** This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.

^ Wireless PictBridge certified printer is required.

A MASTERPIECE OF DESIGN AND TECHNOLOGY
8X OPTICAL ZOOM WITH 28MM WIDE-ANGLE LENS
The PowerShot ELPH 130 IS houses an 8x Optical Zoom lens in a sleek body, delivering outstanding optical performance and versatility. The zoom starts at 28mm wide-angle and extends to 224mm telephoto (35mm equivalent), covering a wide and highly useful range. The telephoto reach gives you the freedom to capture subjects from afar, while the 28mm wide-angle makes it easy to shoot sweeping landscapes, large groups of people and tall buildings.

HIGH RESOLUTION, HIGHLY ADVANCED PERFORMANCE
16.0 MEGAPIXEL IMAGE SENSOR WITH DIGIC 4 IMAGE PROCESSOR
With the PowerShot ELPH 130 IS digital camera's 16.0 Megapixels of resolution, your images are rich and clear, with textures and tiny details faithfully reproduced even at the long end of the 8x Optical Zoom. This high level of resolution is ideal for creating the largest prints, and allows you the flexibility to blow up and crop any section of an image to express your creativity. The DIGIC 4 Image Processor powers the camera's advanced systems and features, ensuring fast, reliable performance with low battery consumption.

DIGIC 4 IMAGE PROCESSOR
Canon DIGIC Image Processors have set the standard for functionality and performance since their groundbreaking introduction in 1999. With each successive generation, DIGIC Image Processors have brought elevated performance and powerful new features to PowerShot digital cameras. The DIGIC 4 Image Processor has ushered in a new level of picture quality and accelerated processing, making possible features such as high-speed continuous shooting, HD video and Face Detection Self-timer.

A SMARTER CAMERA MEANS BETTER PHOTOS
SMART AUTO
Photographers of all levels appreciate a camera – especially a go-anywhere compact digital – that takes the hassle out of capturing beautiful images. The PowerShot ELPH 130 IS gives you Smart AUTO – sophisticated Canon technology that makes getting that great shot as simple as pressing the shutter button. Smart AUTO automatically detects scenes by assessing various factors in both the background and the subject. Detected scenes are analyzed using 32 predefined shooting situations. The camera then makes optimal settings to ensure the best possible image capture when shooting still images. Smart AUTO also includes Advanced Subject Detection, which allows the camera to detect and track non-human moving subjects like animals and vehicles. With Smart AUTO, all you have to do is frame your shot and capture away.

SHOOTING MODES/SPECIAL SCENE MODES
Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. Low Light For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly lit situations. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Long Shutter Use to blur moving subjects for artistic effect, ideal for urban night photography. Stitch Assist Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos. Movie Record video; unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. GORGEOUS HD VIDEO FROM YOUR STILL CAMERA
720P HD VIDEO
You can shoot high definition video anytime, anywhere right from the pocket-sized PowerShot ELPH 130 IS digital camera. With a simple push of the dedicated movie button, you'll be able to instantly record every moment in motion. 720p HD video is smooth, vivid, and beautifully lifelike, making it an ideal way to capture special memories. In addition to being able to shoot 720p HD video at 25 frames per second, the PowerShot ELPH 130 IS can also shoot 640 x 480 VGA video at 30* frames per second.

*Actual frame rate is 29.97 fps.

DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON FOR EASY VIDEO CAPTURE
It's never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. To make shooting video as natural as snapping pictures, the PowerShot ELPH 130 IS has a dedicated movie button. No need to plan ahead, no need to search through menus on the LCD screen; when you feel a moment would be best captured in 720p HD, simply press the button and recording begins. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want.

OPTIMAL IMAGE STABILIZATION IN ANY SITUATION
INTELLIGENT IS AUTOMATICALLY CHOOSES FROM SIX DIFFERENT MODES TO OPTIMIZE IMAGE STABILIZATION FOR THE SHOOTING CONDITION
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot ELPH 130 IS, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. A CHARGE THAT LASTS AS LONG AS A MEMORY
NEW ECO MODE HELPS REDUCE POWER CONSUMPTION FOR LONGER BATTERY LIFE
The PowerShot ELPH 130 IS takes energy conservation to the next level with ECO Mode, which provides more shots per single charge through LCD monitor and camera power management. ECO Mode can be activated for easy power preservation when an outlet is unavailable or the moment is too exciting to put the camera down. ECO Mode quickly wakes the camera from sleep when a button is pressed. With ECO Mode activated to conserve power, you can even stay connected for longer with the built-in Wi-Fi® feature on the PowerShot ELPH 130 IS. When the fun with family and friends runs late into the night, you can be assured your camera can keep up.
feature_bullets: Built in Wi-Fi for wireless transfer of images to socian networking sites
16.0 MP sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor and 720p HD video recording
Smart AUTO with 32 pedefined photo capture settings
ECO mode for economy power consumption

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars755 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
